Name: Kohima War Cemetery, Kohima (Nagaland)
Accessibility: Well-paved paths, wheelchair-friendly in main areas
Guided Tours: Available via local guides; English/Hindi support
Nearby Amenities: Cafes, shops, hotels, restrooms in Kohima town
Special Notes: Maintains graves of soldiers of WWII; famous epitaph “When You Go Home, Tell Them of Us and Say, For Your Tomorrow, We Gave Our Today.”

Name: Dzukou Valley, Kohima District (Nagaland & Manipur border)
Nearest Bus Stand: Kohima Bus Stand (~25 km to trek base)
Timings: Trekking access during daylight; overnight camping allowed
Best Time to Visit: June – September (valley in full bloom); October – March (cool and dry for trekking)
Accessibility: Trekking only; moderate difficulty; not wheelchair accessible
Nearby Amenities: Homestays, small food stalls at base villages
Special Notes: Famous for Dzukou Lilies, rolling green meadows, camping under stars.

Name: Hornbill Festival (Kisama Heritage Village, Kohima District, Nagaland)
Nearest Bus Stand: Kohima Bus Stand (~12 km from Kisama)
Accessibility: Well-connected by road, hilly terrain; not fully wheelchair accessible
Guided Tours: Cultural tours arranged by Nagaland Tourism/local operators
Nearby Amenities: Food stalls, cultural shops, handicraft bazaars, hotels in Kohima
Special Notes: Known as the “Festival of Festivals”; showcases dances, crafts, indigenous sports, and cuisines of all 16 Naga tribes.

Name: Nagaland Zoological Park, Rangapahar (Chümoukedima District, Nagaland)
Accessibility: Good road approach; partial wheelchair access
Guided Tours: Zoo staff available; educational tours arranged
Nearby Amenities: Small canteen, restrooms; hotels/restaurants in Dimapur
Special Notes: Home to hornbills, hoolock gibbons, rare Himalayan species; popular with school groups.

Name: Pulie Badze Wildlife Sanctuary, Kohima District (Nagaland)
Nearest Bus Stand: Kohima Bus Stand (~15 km to Jotsoma village)
Accessibility: Requires trek from Jotsoma; moderate difficulty; not wheelchair friendly
Nearby Amenities: Homestays in Kohima; small shops/restrooms in villages
Special Notes: Known for Blyth’s Tragopan (Nagaland’s state bird); scenic views of Kohima.

Name: Kohima Botanical Garden, Kohima (Nagaland)
Guided Tours: Available by request; staff assist with plant info
Nearby Amenities: Cafés, shops, restrooms in Kohima city
Special Notes: Offers panoramic city views; rich flora; popular for leisure and picnics.

Name: Khonoma Green Village, Kohima District (Nagaland)
Nearest Bus Stand: Kohima Bus Stand (~20 km to Khonoma)
Timings: Open all day; best in daylight
Accessibility: Good road; hilly terrain; not wheelchair friendly
Special Notes: India’s first Green Village; strong conservation practices; rich Angami tribal culture.

Name: Shilloi Lake, Phek District (Nagaland)
Accessibility: Motorable road; last stretch rural roads; not wheelchair friendly
Guided Tours: Local guides available from Phek villages
Nearby Amenities: Guest houses in Phek; small stalls near lake
Special Notes: Known as “Lake of Spirits”; cultural myths; scenic for photography.

Name: Wokha & Mount Tiyi, Wokha District (Nagaland)
Type: Hill Station / Cultural Town / Trekking Spot
Best Time to Visit: November (Tokhu Emong festival); October – March for good weather
Accessibility: Good roads; trekking paths steep at Mount Tiyi; not wheelchair friendly
Guided Tours: Available with local Lotha tribe guides
Nearby Amenities: Markets, restaurants, rest houses in Wokha town
Special Notes: Known for orange orchards, Mount Tiyi trekking, and Lotha tribe’s Tokhu Emong festival.

Name: Tuophema Tourist Village, near Kohima (Nagaland)
Accessibility: Motorable road; village paths uneven; not wheelchair friendly
Special Notes: Preserves Angami traditions; traditional huts, food, crafts; immersive stay
